DIALOGUE BEFORE: Oswald: Up!
RESPONSE TEXT: No matter what you do, I can heal my friends, and we will protect what is ours.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You're wrong! Rachel is going to find a way to cure them, we're going to fix this!
RESPONSE TEXT: My beloved left this place years ago to find a cure to this disease.
In return, I swore that I'd keep our people safe by defending our home.
When Rachel walks back through those gates with the cure in hand, then you'll see, everyone will see, that I was right!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Rachel's dead. Here, she left this for you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Well that does it, then. It's up to me to leave here and find the cure myself.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: Don't worry about the radiation, it will no longer be a burden to you and your kind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Oswald: You Raiders are all the same. You come into someone's home, steal their belongings and kill those they care about.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm not going to let you kill any more of my friends. This is our home, not yours.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm not your enemy. This can end without bloodshed.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You come here, attack my friends, try to steal our home and have the gall to claim you aren't my enemy?
RESPONSE TEXT: We've defended this place for over 200 years. Do you think you're the first outsider I've met that's chosen to brand "feral" ghouls as monsters?
How many of them have you needlessly slaughtered while ignorantly thinking you're doing the world a favor?!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Ghouls like your friends, it's too late for them. The radiation changed them forever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ghouls like your friends, it's too late for them. The radiation changed them forever.
RESPONSE TEXT: So you're admitting my friends are sick and yet you try to kill them anyway?
I'd say that makes you the only monster around here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Ghouls like your friends, it's too late for them. The radiation changed them forever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ghouls like your friends, it's too late for them. The radiation changed them forever.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're wrong! Rachel is going to find a way to cure them, we're going to fix this!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: My beloved left this place years ago to find a cure to this disease.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm done talking. Let's just get this over with.
RESPONSE TEXT: Fine, I've been looking forward to making you disappear.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: My beloved left this place years ago to find a cure to this disease.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: There's no point in arguing anymore. Just leave!
RESPONSE TEXT: Perhaps I would leave, but I made a promise to keep this place safe until my Rachel finds the cure.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: My beloved left this place years ago to find a cure to this disease.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You've been here for 200 years? Why?
RESPONSE TEXT: We worked here as entertainers until the bombs fell. The radiation may have changed us, but we decided to make this place our home.
Over time, the illness took the minds of my friends... and those that we love.
I am going to find a cure, and fix my friends before someone like you comes along and exterminates us all.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Ghouls like your friends, it's too late for them. The radiation changed them forever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Rachel's dead. Here, she left this for you.
RESPONSE TEXT: She's dead? No... no... my poor Rachel.
How could I allow her to leave my side on such a difficult journey alone? This is all my fault.
Well that does it, then. It's up to me to leave here and find the cure myself.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Rachel's dead. Here, she left this for you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe you're right.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Rachel's dead. Here, she left this for you.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.

RESPONSE TEXT: How dare you say that about her! You'll pay for that with your life!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I promise you, there is no cure. You'd be better off trying to find her so you can be together.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're wrong. There is a cure, there has to be. But... maybe she needs my help.
If Rachel is still out there, I'll find her and we'll search for this cure together.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Oswald: I'll gather what remains of my friends and we'll leave this place in your care.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What if she never returns? How long are you going to wait?
RESPONSE TEXT: I will stay here for as long as it takes.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Rachel's dead. Here, she left this for you.
